title: FTSE LIVE: Frozen Woodford fund will not re-open; Pound still climbing on Brexit deal hopes
text:
After being frozen for four months, the Woodford Equity Income Fund set up by fallen fund picker Neil Woodford will be permanently shut down, with any cash raised eventually returned to investors.

The administrators running the fund on Woodford's behalf, said: 'After careful consideration, the decision has now been taken not to re-open the fund and instead to wind it up as soon as practicable.

'This is with a view to returning cash to investors at the earliest opportunity.'

Meanwhile, Oscar winning visual effects firm DNEG has revealed plans to list on the London Stock Exchange in the hope of raising £150million.

And UK wages data will be in focus today as Brexit talks continue. The pound is eking out some gains in early trading in the hope that some compromises may be forthcoming in the next few days.
description: After being frozen for four months, the Woodford Equity Income Fund set up by fallen fund picker Neil Woodford will be permanently shut down, with cash eventually returned to investors.
authors: Emily Hardy For This Is Money
